column4: i'm trying to install myth tv, and i do the ./configure and it says i need to install LAME mp3 stuff.  So i opened the synaptics? packet manager and installed them but i still get the error.  Any thoughts?
wnen compiling from source also add the -dev packages of the dependency required
do you have an example?   (I'm still learning this stuff)
you are in synatpci right ? search for the lame pacakge for exemple , you see the lame package , next to it you will see  lame-dev  install that one as well
Could have sworn i did that, i will double check
Well, i got all but that one, figures.    Ok, so i just did the ./configure and at the end it says ./configure: 3510: qmake: not found
that's a new one to me
consider doing a search in the forum www.ubuntuforums.org
qmake search in the repos returns results about qt3 I would suggest you try installiing qt3-dev-tools
K, thanks i will take a look into that.  but i found a page that almost talks like you can install it with the package manager.
check in menyu > systm < ADMIN > network , check the setting of your wiered connection
Are you sure that was meant for me?
compiling ? then yes
You told me to check my network connection   :P
sorry , no not you
Had me lost for a sec.
Hmm, the whole ./configure and make and make install was just spinning tires.  But i found a page that tells me to
apt always works,   packages in the repos are precompiled
Sorry for the noobness, but can you expound on what the heck an apt, repos, and precompiled things are?  I am a windows dude walking into linux.
Awesome, now it makes more sense.  Thanks

on linux in general you can always compile from the source which means you can pretty much install any app on any distro,  in ubuntu ( and other high-end distros) , you will have repositories of precomplied packages,  meainng that those packages have already been configured to instal with no issues on that particular distro,  ubuntu has the largest repositories of all distros,  all packages in the ubuntu repos will install on your comp
and apt is the command that handles the install
